instructions: Lie down on a flat bench with your feet firmly on the ground.
Grip the barbell with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Lower the barbell to your chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle from your body.
Push the barbell back up until your arms are fully extended.
Place the barbell on your upper back, gripping it with hands wider than shoulder-width apart.
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and toes pointing slightly outward.
Lower your body by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
Push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Stand with your feet hip-width apart and the barbell over your mid-foot.
Bend your knees and hips to lower your body and grip the barbell with an overhand or mixed grip.
Keep your back straight and chest up as you lift the barbell off the ground by extending your hips and knees.
Lower the barbell back to the ground by bending your knees and hips.
Grip a pull-up bar with your hands shoulder-width apart and palms facing away from your body.
Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and feet off the ground.
Pull your body up by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Lower your body back down to the starting position.
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell at your collarbone level with your palms facing forward.
Press the barbell overhead by extending your arms.
Pause for a moment at the top, then lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Sit on the lat pulldown machine and adjust the thigh pad to secure your legs.
Grip the bar with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and palms facing away from your body.
Pull the bar down to your upper chest by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Slowly extend your arms to return the bar to the starting position.
Sit on the pec deck machine facing the back pad and adjust the seat height so the handles are at shoulder level.
Grip the handles with your palms facing inward and elbows slightly bent.
Pull the handles back by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grip the handle with your palms facing up and arms fully extended.
Curl the handle toward your chest by bending your elbows.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip.
Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at your hips, keeping your back straight.
Pull the barbell toward your lower chest by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Sit on the pec deck machine with your back against the pad.
Place your forearms on the padded levers, with your elbows at a 90-degree angle.
Push the levers together by squeezing your chest muscles.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Grip the parallel dip bars with your palms facing inward and arms straight.
Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground.
Push through your palms to return to the starting position.
Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Grip the handle with your palms facing down and elbows bent at a 90-degree angle.
Push the handle down by extending your elbows until your arms are straight.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Lie down on an incline bench with your feet firmly on the ground.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand at chest level, with your palms facing away from your body.
Press the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended.
Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip.
Keeping your back straight and knees slightly bent, hinge forward at your hips to lower the barbell.
Push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Sit on the leg press machine with your back against the pad and feet on the platform.
Adjust the seat so that your knees form a 90-degree angle.
Push through your heels to extend your legs and move the platform away from your body.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Sit on the leg extension machine with your back against the pad.
Place your ankles under the padded lever, adjusting the machine as needed.
Extend your legs by pushing against the padded lever.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Lie face down on the hamstring curl machine with your knees just off the edge of the pad.
Place your ankles under the padded lever, adjusting the machine as needed.
Curl your legs toward your glutes by bending your knees.
Slowly return to the starting position.
